content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.40 - Executive order no. 40: ordering state agencies to register emission reduction credits

State Regulations
WHEREAS, areas of New York State have been designated as
not meeting the national ambient air quality standards for ozone, particulate
matter and carbon monoxide; WHEREAS, New York State is included, in its entirety, in an

Ozone Transport Region, pursuant to section 84 of the Clean Air Act
(42 U.S.C. section
7511
c.); WHEREAS, in areas that are not in attainment with the
national ambient air quality standards, or in those located in an Ozone

Transport Region, the Clean Air Act requires that new sources of nonattainment
contaminants obtain emission reductions of such nonattainment contaminants from
the same source or other sources; WHEREAS, New York State has complied with the Clean Air Act
by adopting 6 NYCRR Subpart
231-2
- "New Source Review in Nonattainment Areas
and Ozone Transport Regions," to require that new sources obtain emission
reductions of such nonattainment contaminants from the same source or other
sources; WHEREAS, air emission reduction credits that can be used as
offsets are produced by source reduction, overcontrol, shutdown, or curtailment
of existing sources of nonattainment contaminants; WHEREAS, air emission reduction credits are vital to
attract new businesses and industries and achieve clean air in the

State; WHEREAS, this administration intends to support a robust
market for emission reduction credits by certifying all eligible State Agency
emission reductions; WHEREAS, the ability of the State to identify and secure
emission reduction credits can be a major point of consideration for firms
seeking to locate in New York State; and
WHEREAS, many offices and agencies of State government have
made air emission reductions that could be certified as emission reduction
credits and be used to encourage economic growth; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order: I. All offices and agencies of State
government to assign staff to investigate whether emission reductions that
could receive credit exist; II. Ensure that such staff work with the Division of Air Resources at New York

State Department of Environmental Conservation (NYSDEC) to certify and register
such credits; III. Such staff shall
ensure that emission reduction credits are certified and registered in
accordance with 6 NYCRR Subpart
231-2; IV. NYSDEC shall facilitate transfer of the
certified emission reduction credits to the Department of Economic Development
(DED) for distribution to new and expanding businesses; V. DED and NYSDEC shall jointly develop
criteria governing eligibility of businesses to use emission reduction credits
in order to obtain air pollution permits; and
VI. The distribution of emission reduction
credits shall be subject to the approval of the Commissioners of DED and
NYSDEC. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: July 26, 1996
